userreviews.userReview: I read these stories one at a time, and will read them all again. Every one is unique, well researched, and takes the characters from points of the unthinkable to amazing ends. Readers will sit quietly when then the finish the last words. Enough said. Keep a pillow under your heart to cushion it.
One of my absolute favorite writers, especially his earliest books!

Love is spelled many ways. One of my favorite things about Charles Martin is his ability to not only paint a picture, but to layer it with sights and smells and sounds. This collection is no different. In each story the reader visits a place they may never have been and it somehow feels familiar. The people are like people we've met or known. It serves as a reminder that we really are only separated from one another by a very thin veil. Not one moment of my time reading here was wasted, not one.
Great collectionThis is three really good stories that make up a great collection. I borrowed these from my online Library. I'm glad that I did and would love to read more of this Author's work.
The best lessonsA wonderful book about coming-of-age of how our surroundings and our upbringing lead us down the path . All of us have the power though to chose . Which path shall I take.?
Loved this set of three books! Outstanding stories by Charles Martin! Each novel unique in its own way and each touches the reader in a special way with a message that speaks of faith.
AwesomeThis is the second of this author's books that I have read. Both are wonderful, I recommend them highly! Enjoy!
Good collectionEach book was great. I believe that I liked Wrapped in Rain the best but am hard pressed to really choose.
All three give very different, amazingly emotional journeys.

Best collection ever!I cannot say enough good about this collection of books. I have read probably thousands of books, but these three are going to be at the top of my list forever right behind the Bible. I love all the descriptions and characters in all 3 books. Charles Martin has my vote for outstanding author! Must read for everyone.

HopeI really admire his work. He is my favorite new author...and I have read a lot of books so this is a compliment. One word sums up his writing-hope. Read and cherish CM's writing...and enjoy the hope he provides.
Superb....Again, Charles Martin .... love his thoughtful writing..

description:
Three novels from New York Times bestselling author Charles Martin now available in one e-book collection.

  
    When Crickets Cry
  
A man with a painful past. A child with a doubtful future. And a shared journey toward healing for both their hearts.It begins on the shaded town square in a sleepy Southern town. A spirited seven-year-old has a brisk business at her lemonade stand. But the little girl’s pretty yellow dress can’t quite hide the ugly scar on her chest.Her latest customer, a bearded stranger, drains his cup and heads to his car, his mind on a boat he's restoring at a nearby lake. The stranger understands more about the scar than he wants to admit. And the beat-up bread truck careening around the corner with its radio blaring is about to change the trajectory of both their lives.Before it's over, they'll both know there are painful reasons why crickets cry . . . and that miracles lurk around unexpected corners.
  
    Chasing Fireflies
  
They have one summer to find what was lost long ago.“Never settle for less than the truth,” she told him. But when you don't even know your real name, the truth gets a little complicated. It can nestle so close to home it's hard to see. It can even flourish inside a lie. And as Chase Walker discovered, learning the truth about who you are can be as elusive—and as magical—as chasing fireflies on a summer night.A haunting story about fishing, baseball, home cooking, and other matters of life and death.
  
    Wrapped in Rain
  
An internationally famous photographer, Tucker Mason, has traveled the world, capturing things other people don’t see. But what Tucker himself can’t see is how to let go of the past and forgive his father.On a sprawling Southern estate, Tucker and his younger brother, Mutt, were raised by their housekeeper, Miss Ella Rain, who loved the motherless boys like her own. Hiring her to take care of Waverly Hall and the boys was the only good thing their father ever did.When his brother escapes from a mental hospital and an old girlfriend appears with her son and a black eye, Tucker is forced to return home and face the agony of his own tragic past.Though Miss Ella has been gone for many years, Tuck can still hear her voice—and her prayers.
